greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fourier coefficients of T_0.
comment: In Siegel's notation, Delta has been normalized already.
T_0 is unique weight-2 normalized meromorphic modular form for SL(2,Z) with all poles at infinity.
reference: C. L. Siegel, Advanced Analytic Number Theory, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Bombay, 1980, pp. 249-268.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = -1..1000
formula: Expansion of (j(q)^4 (j(q) - 1728)^3 Delta(q))^(1/6) in powers of q = exp(2 Pi i t). - _Michael Somos_, Jul 29 2014
G.f.: -q*j' where j is the elliptic modular invariant (A000521). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jul 12 2017
mathematica: a[n_] := -n*SeriesCoefficient[1728*KleinInvariantJ[-Log[q]*I/(2*Pi)], {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, -1, 14}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 02 2017, after _Seiichi Manyama_ *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<-1, 0, A = x^3 * O(x^n); polcoeff( (x * eta(x + A)^24 * ellj(x + A)^4 * (ellj(x + A) - 1728)^3)^(1/6), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 29 2014 */
(PARI) {a(n) = if( n<-1, 0, polcoeff( -x * ellj(x + x^3 * O(x^n))', n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 31 2018 */
results.author: Barry Brent (barryb(AT)primenet.com)
